meanings.definition: The quality or state of being brittle.
meanings.sent1: The brittlenesses of the old vase made it easy to break.
meanings.sent2: The brittlenesses of the dry twigs made them snap with a gentle touch.
meanings.sent3: The brittlenesses of the cookies made them crumble into tiny pieces when touched.
meanings.sent4: The brittlenesses of his trust shattered like glass when he discovered the truth.
meanings.sent5: The brittlenesses of the ice made it crack loudly under the weight of the skater.

meanings.definition: The tendency to break or shatter easily.
meanings.sent1: The brittlenesses of the thin glass made it dangerous to handle.
meanings.sent2: The brittlenesses of the old bones made them prone to fractures.
meanings.sent3: The brittlenesses of the relationship were evident when a small argument led to a big fight.
meanings.sent4: The brittlenesses of her patience finally gave way under the constant pressure.
meanings.sent5: The brittlenesses of the dried leaves made them crumble at the lightest touch.
